description: Pedigree studies in which the individual is part of.
An identifier that is used to identify related pedigree members
Additional identifiers that identify a pedigree
Information on whether the patient is a child from two family members who are second cousins or closer.

List of members of the pedigree. If the current pedigree definition is attached to the proband, it contains the whole list of pedigree members, including the proband. If the definition is attached to an individual different than the proband, it only contains two entries: one that describes that member, e.g. the proband mother or father, and one that points to the proband.
Any of the individuals who are descended from a common progenitor, related by marriage or other legal tie, or by a feeling of closeness.
The individual used as a starting point to define a relationship
One or more individuals from which a relationship can be determined
The relationship between two or more individuals (e.g., proband, mother, father, siblings, etc.)
Is the individual affected by the disease in the pedigree?
